definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord?
sentences.chinese: 哥尼流定睛看他，惊怕说，主阿，什么事呢。

sentences.english: Fix eyes on frolic wild fowls on the moor water.
sentences.chinese: 定睛凝视水泊上嬉戏的野禽。

sentences.english: It is well for us to fix our eyes upon the blood of the one offering for sin.
sentences.chinese: 定睛在宝血上是必要的，因为那是惟一的赎罪祭。

sentences.english: The eyes of all in the synagogue were fixed on him.
sentences.chinese: 会堂里的人都定睛看他。

sentences.english: Love is the eternal and lasting lighthouse, which watches the storm unswervingly.
sentences.chinese: 爱是亘古的长期的灯塔，它定睛望着风暴却兀不为动。

sentences.english: Fix eyes on frolic wild f…
sentences.chinese: 定睛凝视水泊上嬉戏的野禽。

definition: to take a furtive look at
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to come close/to get near to/front
to collect one's thoughts (after being surprised or shocked)/to snap out of it (after being lost in thought)
